author: wvalthar
title: @chain-lib Bidding Smart Contract
description: Debe ser fácil para los usuarios poner un artículo o un paquete de artículos para que los usuarios pujen, en su sitio web, sin una tonelada de conocimientos técnicos.

f6_assessments.q0: The same with other proposals of this team, the problem that the team proposes is within this challenge. But there is no info in the proposal that shows their project will add more value to the Cardano ecosystem, even they don't have any key metrics. And after 4 proposal with the same content, I don't think this team really care about what challenge address.
f6_assessments.q1:
Can't score the feasibility of this project. The team provides a GitHub but I don't know what it will be used for. 
Moreover, they don't have a roadmap and KPI to show their detailed step-to-step of developing this project. So, it is hard to assess that their budget is reasonable.
f6_assessments.q2:
The team lacks of: roadmap and key metrics. For helping Catalyst community audit the proposal, the team should give a detailed roadmap with a timeline that is realistic. 
One more thing that the team doesn't have here is a detailed explanation about the problem, and their solution is just a brief in the overview, that all make sense how they will solve the problem or how hard they study about the problem to make a best solution.

f6_assessments.q0: This is another good idea. In Problem statement proposal clearly defines problems and offers a good alternative, problem solving. This proposal could have a positive impact on the Cardano ecosystem. By describing What is chain-lib / cardano-api & chain-lib / cardano-components in proposal we could conclude that if this project would come to realization it would add value to the Cardano ecosystem. Unfortunately no KPIs are listed so we cannot compare KPIs with challenge setting. It would be good to approach each proposal with understanding and have time to make a proposal. There are groups on the Telegram where you get all the necessary information on how to make a proposal, and there are also workshops.
f6_assessments.q1: This proposal has a Github link where information on experience / skill is visible but it would be better to know who is behind this project. It would be great to put links about the team as proof of experience and skill. Unfortunately, nowhere in this proposal is the number of people who will work on this project mentioned. It would be good to have information on how many people will be working on this project and who these people are. In this proposal additional funding is not required and therefore there is no additional funding plan. It would be good to have a detailed implementable plan and details of actionable tasks and order of execution. The proposal states that the project will be implemented in 12 months, but we do not have a clear insight into how certain steps in the project will take place. It is clearly evident the amount of money they are asking for in this proposal. It would be also good to explain whether people are needed to realize the whole project. It would be good to mention if there are risks and in wich  way if they arise they would approach them and how to solve them. It remains a great unknown what is needed in the construction, the implementation itself.
f6_assessments.q2: In the proposition states a time horizon for an achievement of 6 and 12 months, but it is not clear what will happen and in what way at that time. It would be good to have a roadmap with milestones, KPIs. If the proposal had a roadmap with milestones and KPIs Cardano community could follow the development of the project.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal has a problem that within the challenge but has nothing in detail. It doesn't have info about how it will impact on Cardano ecosystem. 
It also doesn't have any key metrics or plans to measure whether what this idea brings is meet the challenge or not.
f6_assessments.q1:
This proposal lack all basic info for assessing the feasibility. The short brief is not enough for assessing. They should inclcude: 
- Detailed implementation plan for knowing what they will do with their solution to address the problem. Not just about the features, but also includes use cases, technology explanation, marketing, activities... the more detail is great
- Detailed roadmap and budget to assess that are they reasonable with plan or not 
- Team info to clarify the ability to execute the plan 
- Relevant risk to know that the team experiencing and well-preparing for the idea.
f6_assessments.q2:
Cannot scoring the auditability of this proposal because it lacks everything for that. For auditing the progress and success of the proposal, it must have: 
- A roadmap with milestones and a time horizon for achievement. And metrics/KPIs that define the success of the proposal. Those 2 will help Catalyst track and audit in periods. 
- Clear understandable description of the targeted problem. And the clear understandable solution that addresses the problem. These 2 will help to know what is this proposal expects up front. 
This proposal have none of them.

f6_assessments.q0: Auction is one of the necessary for developing the market, here is NFT market as I understand within this project. But, the proposer only shows problem, solution that can help to solve, and a few words to over what they want to to that hard to well understand to assessing what he wants. Also, he doesn't provide any key metric or info to prove that this solution will help the Cardano ecosystem. This proposal failed to impact.
f6_assessments.q1: There is only a short over about the solution this proposal wants to show and an introduction about already-made open-source of the team that can't understand how it can help this project. My advice for this team is to have a good proposal and enough materials for assessing the feasibility they must give info about a detailed plan they will do, roadmap that with a clear timeline of activities will get instead of just 2 milestone of 6 months and 12 months, clarify team member info for more trust, the budget that is reasonable with the plan and roadmap, risk-relevant that team will face off. Technically, this idea of the project will have a lot of technical stuff but they don't describe any of them, including smart contract, protocol... even more in the user point of view including UX/UI, user cases...
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposer provide nothing in this proposal to audit it. 
No plan, no roadmap, no key metrics in this proposal.
There is also no info about the problem explanation and no info to say how the solution can help to solve the problem.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is about creating a web component and smart contract that allows for creating bundles the can then be displayed and sold on your website easily. The problem is described, and explained in detail. The solution is defined, with potential impact in certain aspects. Therefore, based on the given information, I am neutral with this proposal's impact, I can rate it with a score of 3
f6_assessments.q1: Team [Chain-lib] profile is provided and described enough for understanding with suitable skill and experiences for implementation. However, each member's ability can not be found, and is hard to verify. Besides, there is not any information on similar works done by this team. The budget is clearly provided with items structure and explanations of calculation base. However, KPIs and Risk (and mitigation) were not provided. Therefore, based on the given information, I am neutral with this proposal's feasibility, I can rate it with a score of 3
f6_assessments.q2: There is a lack of information: (1) Each team [from Chain-Lib] member's profile and external links for verification; (2) KPIs, (3) Risk (and mitigation). Besides, there is no information on similar works done by this team. Therefore, based on the given information, I disagree with this proposal's auditability, I can rate it with a score of 2

f6_assessments.q0: The proposition that defines the challenge that needs to be solved is Creating a web component and smart contract that allows the creation of packages that can then be displayed and sold on your website easily. This proposal will add value to the cardano ecosystem by allowing anyone to bid on nfts, on the nft creator website, without having to go to some external store, without having to is an expert on nft.
f6_assessments.q1: The team said they has related experience Novella / Cardano Keys Developer, SPO, Alanzo Purple tester, Plutus Pioneer 1, and has built some components inside github repo. but apart from the gifhub link that was last active 2 weeks ago, no updates have been seen, nor is there any identification information or the number of members. The budget is divided into 3 parts but there is no specific plan to use it and cannot verify these issues
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has not provided any key metrics /KPI or solutions to determine if the proposal is successful

solution: Cree un componente web y un contrato inteligente que permita crear paquetes que luego se puedan mostrar y vender en su sitio web fácilmente.
experience: Desarrollador de Novella / Cardano Keys, SPO, Alanzo Purple tester, Plutus Pioneer 1, y ya ha construido varios componentes dentro del repo de github.
